text.Contract title and description: PROJ10011 Independent evaluation contract for the Girls’ Education Challenge Fund Phase II (GEC II)
text.KPI name and description:
Extent to which supplier is responsive and flexible to FCDO and other stakeholder needs.
Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
•            6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
•            5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
•            4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
•            3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
•            2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
•            1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
– KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract

text.KPI name and description:
Number of Lower Threshold Outcomes Against Profile - 
"For those in employment, a lower threshold Outcome Payment will be achieved when a Participant’s earnings reach an earnings threshold equivalent to the
Participant working at the National Living Wage NLW for the over 25s for 8
hours per week for 182 days."
text.Comments: Due to the impact of Covid-19, The Growth Company (TGC) struggled at the beginning of 2021 to generate a sufficient First Job Entry pipeline, impacting their ability to subsequently achieve their Lower Threshold Outcome (LTO) and Higher Threshold Outcome (HTO) profiles. For this reason, TGC were escalated to a higher level of the Performance Management Intervention Regime (PMIR Level 2) in November. This escalation included an increased level of Senior Management scrutiny on TGC’s performance improvement measures whilst providing extra tailored support.

text.Contract title and description: Directorate for a Research and Innovation Hub on Technology for Education
text.KPI name and description: Percentage of variance from the forecasted financial values
text.Comments: The Hub continues to refine its finance systems and reporting, and improve its ability to scope work. A range of factors influenced the ability to forecast accurately in 2021, including 1) Receiving the annual budget settlement towards the end of Q1 and not before ; 2) The longer than anticipated time to agree the research portfolio; 3) Delays from partners in negotiating the ASR work plans; 4) Lack of adequate capacity within the Central Services and technical teams to appropriately scope and budget work; 5) The introduction of output-based budgeting which required a cultural change. The Hub now has a new Finance Manager in place, has developed new budgeting and reporting tools, is providing greater support and guidance to technical teams in scoping and budgeting, and has moved to monthly (not quarterly) forecasting.

Helpdesk response to calls, enquiries and complaints

•	 the abandoned call rate will not exceed 5% of the total calls each day 
•	 at least 99% of inbound queries and complaints will be resolved within 5 Business Days 
•	 100% of inbound enquiries and complaints will be resolved within 8 Business Days. 
•	 85% of all enquiries must be resolved at first point of contact 
•	 at least 99% of all complaints are acknowledged by email and forwarded (where appropriate) within 1 Business Day of receipt 
•	 at least 99% of all complaints to the Helpdesk must be resolved within 15 Business Days of receipt 
•	 100% of emails, faxes, and letters and text enquiries must be acknowledged within 1 Business Day of receipt 
•	 availability of the Helpdesk as set out in Goal 12 in Schedule 4 (Services) Part 1 (Statement of Requirements)

10 to 50% of users unable to access a national service, business critical function unavailable or working incorrectly, overnight processing fails to update non business critical data or failure of printed output to the public.

Priority 1

Priority 2
All Incidents but two (2) are Resolved within the baseline target Resolution Time of (8) Service Hours

text.KPI name and description:
Data Analytics: Availability - Portfolio (ID 28)

To meet this Service Level, the Supplier must achieve the requirements set out in (i) and  (ii) and (iii) below:
(i)	the agreed percentage of the applications in the Delivery Group meet or exceed the Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category; 
(ii)	the average Availability of all applications within each Service Level Category meets or exceeds the Average Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category; and
(iii)	each application in the Delivery Group meets or exceeds the Minimum Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category (Gold, Silver, Bronze).
text.Good target:
Target Service Level

Gold Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 99.9%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 99.93%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target 99%

Silver Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 99%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 99.3%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target = 97.5%

Bronze Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 98%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 98.5%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target = 96%

text.Contract title and description: Facilities Management Asia Pacific
text.Supplier: Jones Lang LaSalle Property Consultants Pte Ltd
text.KPI name and description: User Experience:  comprising MI to monitor; availability of helpdesk (target 99.95%, threshold 99.5%), provision of suitable safe property in timescales, achievement of Helpdesk response times, Staff Residential Property (SRP) response & SRP rectification of reactive work, Customer Satisfaction, (target 95%, threshold 90%),  SRP Customer Satisfaction (target 90%, threshold 85%), Complaints (target 2%, threshold 4%),  All MIs are weighted to contribute to the KPI, at a Post and contract level
text.Comments: This is the third set of scores from a new FM contract in Asia Pacific with JLL.  During the 6 month transition period (April 21 to Oct 21) we worked with JLL to validate the KPI scoring logic; calculation method; establish business rules and processes for each KPI to ensure accurate reporting and the integrity of the data.  This is still a work in progress with some IT glitches and we are investigating a technical issue which we believe is adversely affecting the score.  Expectation among all parties is that this will be improve once resolved.  There are 2 MIs within the Operational Performance KPI that are being reviewed.  The key area of failure within this KPI is reactive tasks and these are being reviewed weekly. The Sustainability KPI failed in Month 3 due to reporting difficulties within the region and this is expected to be resolved in February.  Within the Management KPI there remain some further actions that need to be completed by JLL for them to provide acceptable reports; these are being addressed in January.  The User Experience score has been affected by delivery of reactive services to Staff Residential Properties.  The root cause for this is under investigation.

Maintenance and Safety Works - Meet the five measures of site perimeter, hoardings and scaffolding inspection and maintenance. These are:1 All hoardings, paths and signage surrounding site to be kept clean and tidy at all times 
2 Security patrols to maintain secure site with zero incidents in month 
3 Scaffold inspections to be carried out minimum weekly and reporting shared with client team 
4 The Supplier to complete at least two senior management safety and perimeter inspection tours per month 
5 The Supplier to have completed at least one on-site training session which is also open to the community
